lmforecast function

Source: R/lmforecast.R
lmforecast.Rd

lmforecast function

Usage

lmforecast(x, a, m, e)

Arguments

x

A numeric vector, identifying the covariate of the model

a

A numeric vector, The intercept

m

A numeric vector, The slope, or the betas estimated values

e

A numeric vector, The error

Value

A dataframe containing the vector with the estimation, and the original data

Examples

x <- rnorm(n = 50, mean = 0, sd = 1)
lmforecast(
x = x,
a = 0.1,
m = dunif(x, min = 0.02, max = 1),
e = rnorm(length(x), mean = 0, sd = 1))
